Description: Barrel-shaped vase of pink marl pottery: with a flat base and convex sides. The mouth is surrounded by an external roll-rim. The surface of the vase has been eroded by salt action, but traces of original red slip are preserved.
Curator's comments: For the excavation, see E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, 'Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna' (London, 1911).
Condition: fair (surface flaking due to salt action)
